answers.answer: I am not a physician, but the mom of a type one and a daughter of a type 2.  I would suggest that you speak to your doctor or see and endocrinologist. There are other tests besides a glucose tolerance test that they can do.  I also would not suggest that you do your own testis if you go too high or too low, you can hurt body.  (i.e.: going in to a coma or having seizures.)If your doctor cannot figure it out what is going on, get a second opinion.
you could ask your dr to perform a hemoglobin A1C blood test..this will give them an average of what your blood sugar has been over that past 3 months...
